channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Exp4Fuse: A Rank Fusion Framework for Enhanced Sparse Retrieval using Large Language Model-based Query Expansion
item.description: However, the efficacy of this method is highly dependent on the quality of the generated documents, which often requires complex prompt strategies and the integration of advanced dense retrieval techniques.

item.title: GOLFer: Smaller LM-Generated Documents Hallucination Filter & Combiner for Query Expansion in Information Retrieval
item.description: Large language models (LLMs)-based query expansion for information retrieval augments queries with generated hypothetical documents with LLMs.

item.title: Time to Talk: LLM Agents for Asynchronous Group Communication in Mafia Games
item.description: For example, in group chats, online team meetings, or social games, there is no inherent notion of turns; therefore, the decision of when to speak forms a crucial part of the participant's decision making.

item.title: Progressive Tempering Sampler with Diffusion
item.description: We also introduce a novel method to combine high-temperature diffusion models to generate approximate lower-temperature samples, which are minimally refined using MCMC and used to train the next diffusion model.

item.title: OGGSplat: Open Gaussian Growing for Generalizable Reconstruction with Expanded Field-of-View
item.description: To evaluate our method, we establish a Gaussian Outpainting (GO) benchmark that assesses both semantic and generative quality of reconstructed open-vocabulary scenes.

item.title: FPGA-Enabled Machine Learning Applications in Earth Observation: A Systematic Review
item.description: New UAV technologies and the NewSpace era are transforming Earth Observation missions and data acquisition.

item.title: ViTSGMM: A Robust Semi-Supervised Image Recognition Network Using Sparse Labels
item.description: We present ViTSGMM, an image recognition network that leverages semi-supervised learning in a highly efficient manner.

item.title: Photoreal Scene Reconstruction from an Egocentric Device
item.description: In this paper, we investigate the challenges associated with using egocentric devices to photorealistic reconstruct the scene in high dynamic range.

item.title: Diffusion Domain Teacher: Diffusion Guided Domain Adaptive Object Detector
item.description: To effectively leverage the cross-domain feature representation of diffusion models, in this paper, we train a detector with frozen-weight diffusion model on the source domain, then employ it as a teacher model to generate pseudo labels on the unlabeled target domain, which are used to guide the supervised learning of the student model on the target domain.

item.title: Pruning Everything, Everywhere, All at Once
item.description: To fill this gap and leverage the benefits of eliminating neurons and layers at once, we propose a new method capable of pruning different structures within a model as follows.

item.title: TextAtari: 100K Frames Game Playing with Language Agents
item.description: We present TextAtari, a benchmark for evaluating language agents on very long-horizon decision-making tasks spanning up to 100, 000 steps.

item.title: N$^2$: A Unified Python Package and Test Bench for Nearest Neighbor-Based Matrix Completion
item.description: Nearest neighbor (NN) methods have re-emerged as competitive tools for matrix completion, offering strong empirical performance and recent theoretical guarantees, including entry-wise error bounds, confidence intervals, and minimax optimality.

item.title: Survey of Active Learning Hyperparameters: Insights from a Large-Scale Experimental Grid
item.description: In this study, we first compiled a large hyperparameter grid of over 4. 6 million hyperparameter combinations, second, recorded the performance of all combinations in the so-far biggest conducted AL study, and third, analyzed the impact of each hyperparameter in the experiment results.

item.title: GARG-AML against Smurfing: A Scalable and Interpretable Graph-Based Framework for Anti-Money Laundering
item.description: Money laundering poses a significant challenge as it is estimated to account for 2%-5% of the global GDP.

item.title: Adapt before Continual Learning
item.description: Continual Learning (CL) seeks to enable neural networks to incrementally acquire new knowledge (plasticity) while retaining existing knowledge (stability).

item.title: POLARIS: A High-contrast Polarimetric Imaging Benchmark Dataset for Exoplanetary Disk Representation Learning
item.description: With over 1, 000, 000 images from more than 10, 000 exposures using state-of-the-art high-contrast imagers (e. g., Gemini Planet Imager, VLT/SPHERE) in the search for exoplanets, can artificial intelligence (AI) serve as a transformative tool in imaging Earth-like exoplanets in the coming decade?

item.title: Rethinking the Stability-Plasticity Trade-off in Continual Learning from an Architectural Perspective
item.description: While numerous CL methods aim to achieve this trade-off, they often overlook the impact of network architecture on stability and plasticity, restricting the trade-off to the parameter level.

item.title: From Theory to Practice with RAVEN-UCB: Addressing Non-Stationarity in Multi-Armed Bandits through Variance Adaptation
item.description: The Multi-Armed Bandit (MAB) problem is challenging in non-stationary environments where reward distributions evolve dynamically.

item.title: EyeNavGS: A 6-DoF Navigation Dataset and Record-n-Replay Software for Real-World 3DGS Scenes in VR
item.description: The EyeNavGS dataset is available at: https://symmru. github. io/EyeNavGS/.

item.title: Dense Match Summarization for Faster Two-view Estimation
item.description: In this paper, we speed up robust two-view relative pose from dense correspondences.

item.title: Occlusion-Aware Ground Target Tracking by a Dubins Vehicle Using Visibility Volumes
item.description: The time-varying VV is approximated by placing static VVs along the POI's trajectory using an adaptive metric that restricts the volume change of consecutive visibility volumes to below a specified rate.

item.title: GeneA-SLAM2: Dynamic SLAM with AutoEncoder-Preprocessed Genetic Keypoints Resampling and Depth Variance-Guided Dynamic Region Removal
item.description: Therefore, this paper proposes a robust and efficient GeneA-SLAM2 system that leverages depth variance constraints to handle dynamic scenes.

item.title: SViMo: Synchronized Diffusion for Video and Motion Generation in Hand-object Interaction Scenarios
item.description: Recognizing that visual appearance and motion patterns share fundamental physical laws in the real world, we propose a novel framework that combines visual priors and dynamic constraints within a synchronized diffusion process to generate the HOI video and motion simultaneously.

item.title: Synthesis of discrete-continuous quantum circuits with multimodal diffusion models
item.description: Efficiently compiling quantum operations remains a major bottleneck in scaling quantum computing.

item.title: WHEN TO ACT, WHEN TO WAIT: Modeling Structural Trajectories for Intent Triggerability in Task-Oriented Dialogue
item.description: Task-oriented dialogue systems often face difficulties when user utterances seem semantically complete but lack necessary structural information for appropriate system action.

item.title: AgentCPM-GUI: Building Mobile-Use Agents with Reinforcement Fine-Tuning
item.description: The recent progress of large language model agents has opened new possibilities for automating tasks through graphical user interfaces (GUIs), especially in mobile environments where intelligent interaction can greatly enhance usability.

item.title: TimeGraph: Synthetic Benchmark Datasets for Robust Time-Series Causal Discovery
item.description: Robust causal discovery in time series datasets depends on reliable benchmark datasets with known ground-truth causal relationships.

item.title: Constrained Sliced Wasserstein Embedding
item.description: We introduce a constrained learning approach to optimize the slicing directions for SW distances.

item.title: Automatic Stage Lighting Control: Is it a Rule-Driven Process or Generative Task?
item.description: Stage lighting plays an essential role in live music performances, influencing the engaging experience of both musicians and audiences.

item.title: Confidence intervals for forced alignment boundaries using model ensembles
item.description: Forced alignment is a common tool to align audio with orthographic and phonetic transcriptions.

item.title: SOC-DGL: Social Interaction Behavior Inspired Dual Graph Learning Framework for Drug-Target Interaction Identification
item.description: The identification of drug-target interactions (DTI) is crucial for drug discovery and repositioning, as it reveals potential uses of existing drugs, aiding in the acceleration of the drug development process and reducing associated costs.

item.title: Compiler Optimization via LLM Reasoning for Efficient Model Serving
item.description: To that end, we introduce a novel compilation framework (dubbed REASONING COMPILER) that formulates optimization as a sequential, context-aware decision process, guided by a large language model and structured Monte Carlo tree search (MCTS).

item.title: Parameter Efficient Fine Tuning Llama 3.1 for Answering Arabic Legal Questions: A Case Study on Jordanian Laws
item.description: This study uses Jordanian law as a case study to explore the fine-tuning of the Llama-3. 1 large language model for Arabic question-answering.

item.title: Is PMBOK Guide the Right Fit for AI? Re-evaluating Project Management in the Face of Artificial Intelligence Projects
item.description: This paper critically evaluates the applicability of the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK) Guide framework to Artificial Intelligence (AI) software projects, highlighting key limitations and proposing tailored adaptations.

item.title: TaxaDiffusion: Progressively Trained Diffusion Model for Fine-Grained Species Generation
item.description: We propose TaxaDiffusion, a taxonomy-informed training framework for diffusion models to generate fine-grained animal images with high morphological and identity accuracy.

item.title: EfficientFER: EfficientNetv2 Based Deep Learning Approach for Facial Expression Recognition
item.description: Facial expression recognition (FER), aiming to classify human emotions automatically, is a significant problem in computer vision.

item.title: Reasoning-Table: Exploring Reinforcement Learning for Table Reasoning
item.description: The approach also achieves excellent performance on text-to-SQL tasks, reaching 68. 3% performance on the BIRD dev dataset with a 7B model.

item.title: GLoSS: Generative Language Models with Semantic Search for Sequential Recommendation
item.description: We propose Generative Low-rank language model with Semantic Search (GLoSS), a generative recommendation framework that combines large language models with dense retrieval for sequential recommendation.

item.title: Ridgeformer: Mutli-Stage Contrastive Training For Fine-grained Cross-Domain Fingerprint Recognition
item.description: The increasing demand for hygienic and portable biometric systems has underscored the critical need for advancements in contactless fingerprint recognition.

item.title: ACCESS DENIED INC: The First Benchmark Environment for Sensitivity Awareness
item.description: To address this, we propose the concept of sensitivity awareness (SA), which enables LLMs to adhere to predefined access rights rules.

item.title: Mispronunciation Detection Without L2 Pronunciation Dataset in Low-Resource Setting: A Case Study in Finland Swedish
item.description: Mispronunciation detection (MD) models are the cornerstones of many language learning applications.

item.title: LEMONADE: A Large Multilingual Expert-Annotated Abstractive Event Dataset for the Real World
item.description: This paper presents LEMONADE, a large-scale conflict event dataset comprising 39, 786 events across 20 languages and 171 countries, with extensive coverage of region-specific entities.

item.title: Geo-Sign: Hyperbolic Contrastive Regularisation for Geometrically Aware Sign Language Translation
item.description: This work demonstrates the potential of hyperbolic geometry to improve skeletal representations for Sign Language Translation, improving on SOTA RGB methods while preserving privacy and improving computational efficiency.

item.title: No Soundness in the Real World: On the Challenges of the Verification of Deployed Neural Networks
item.description: To mislead the verifiers, we create adversarial networks that detect and exploit features of the deployment environment, such as the order and precision of floating point operations.

item.title: MedBookVQA: A Systematic and Comprehensive Medical Benchmark Derived from Open-Access Book
item.description: Our findings highlight critical capability gaps in current GMAI systems while establishing textbook-derived multimodal benchmarks as essential evaluation tools.

item.title: Neuro2Semantic: A Transfer Learning Framework for Semantic Reconstruction of Continuous Language from Human Intracranial EEG
item.description: Decoding continuous language from neural signals remains a significant challenge in the intersection of neuroscience and artificial intelligence.

item.title: IRT-Router: Effective and Interpretable Multi-LLM Routing via Item Response Theory
item.description: However, selecting the optimal LLM to respond to a user query often necessitates a delicate balance between performance and cost.

item.title: MIRROR: Cognitive Inner Monologue Between Conversational Turns for Persistent Reflection and Reasoning in Conversational LLMs
item.description: Human intelligence relies on inner monologue to process complex information through simultaneous reflection, memory retrieval, and response formulation.

item.title: G2S: A General-to-Specific Learning Framework for Temporal Knowledge Graph Forecasting with Large Language Models
item.description: To enhance the generalization ability of LLMs on this task, in this paper, we propose a General-to-Specific learning framework (G2S) that disentangles the learning processes of the above two kinds of knowledge.

item.title: Clinical Annotations for Automatic Stuttering Severity Assessment
item.description: Stuttering is a complex disorder that requires specialized expertise for effective assessment and treatment.
